The '''1830s''' decade ran from January 1, 1830 to December 31, 1839.
== Politics and wars == === Wars === * The [[First Opium War]] between the [[United Kingdom]] and the [[Qing Dynasty|Qing Empire]] of [[China]] started in 1839. It would end three years later with the signing of the [[Treaty of Nanking]] on 29 August 1842.
=== Internal conflicts === [[File:EugÃ¨ne Delacroix - La libertÃ© guidant le peuple.jpg|right|thumb|[[July Revolution|French Revolution of 1830]]]] * [[July Revolution|French Revolution of 1830]] * [[Egba]] refugees fleeing the [[Yoruba people|Yoruba]] civil wars found the city of [[Abeokuta]] in south-west [[Nigeria]]. * The stealthy murderers called "[[Thuggee|thugs]]" are eradicated by [[William Henry Sleeman|William Sleeman]] and his team in [[British India]]. * [[Texas Revolution]] begins in Texas.
=== Decolonization and Independence === * The Brussels Parliament declares [[Belgium|Belgian]] independence, in revolt against the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] government. * The various Maori chieftains of [[Northland Region|Northland]] region of [[North Island]] [[Declaration of Independence of New Zealand|proclaim their independence]] as the United Tribes of New Zealand, under the guidance of [[James Bubsby]]. The British Crown immediately recognizes their claim.
== Assassinations == {{Expand section|date=January 2010}} * The first [[assassination]] attempt on an [[President of the United States|American President]] with [[Andrew Jackson]] being shot at twice.
== Science and Technology == [[File:Phot-34a-05-fullres.jpg|thumb|right|[[Robert's Quartet]]]] * [[Electromagnetic induction]] discovered by [[Michael Faraday]]. * [[Railroad]] construction begins in earnest in the [[United States]]. * [[Robert's Quartet]], a group of galaxies, is discovered. * [[Evolution]]ary theorist [[Charles Darwin#Journey of the Beagle|Charles Darwin]]'s expedition on the ''[[Second voyage of HMS Beagle|HMS Beagle]].''
== Economics == * A period of economic [[prosperity]] in America and [[Europe]], mainly due to increasing [[trade]], the mass production of [[railroads]], and the [[Erie Canal]]. * Dutch-speaking farmers known as [[Voortrekkers]] emigrate northwards from the [[Cape Colony]]. * The destruction of the [[Second Bank of the United States]] in 1836.
==Popular culture== {{Expand section|date=January 2010}}
=== Religion === * [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]] founded by [[Joseph Smith, Jr.|Joseph Smith]].
=== Music === {{Main|1830s in music}} * [[Richard Wagner]] completes his first opera, [[Die Feen]] (The Fairies).
=== Sports === {{Main|1830s in sports}} * [[Croquet]] invented in [[Ireland]].
=== Fashion === {{Main|1830s in fashion}} * Innovations in [[roller printing on textiles]] introduced new dress fabrics. * Broad, exaggerated sleeves for women and padded shoulders for men contrasted a narrow, idealized waist. * [[Brocade]]s come back into style. * Low boots with [[Elastomer|elastic]] insets appear. * ''Greatcoats'', overcoats with wide sleeves, become fashionable for men to wear with day wear.
